intro: Evax anatolica f. hispanica, commonly known as the Spanish form of the Anatolian evax, is a rare and distinctive plant species within the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils in Mediterranean climates. It is noted for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance. Due to its limited natural distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
